titlestmt.titleproper: A Guide to the General or Miscellaneous audiovisual materials FA466
titlestmt.author: Laura Montgomery

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2020-09-12 15:38:23 -0400.

did.unittitle: General or Miscellaneous audiovisual materials

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: When requesting to view audiovisual material, please refer to the Title and the AV Number (example: AV 1916). Researchers are asked to check the "Restrictions" note for each Title. If a Title does not currently have an access copy, please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation note
prefercite.p: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials note
separatedmaterial.p: The majority of audiovisual materials have been physically separated from an archival collection.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This aggregation of miscellaneous audiovisual materials is an artificial collection created by the RAC in order to efficiently and effectively manage and present the miscellaneous moving images and audio materials held among our archival holdings.

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: Since the contents of this Miscellaneous collection have inherently been separated from other archival holdings, the description of any individual item, or set of items, may also currently appear, in some form, in the finding aid for the originating collection.
Future processing, description, and presentation of Films will seek to address this issue as much as feasible.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: In most cases, the specific details of the provenance are unknown.

did.unittitle: General or Miscellaneous films

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The original provenance, and/or specific association with RAC archival holdings, of the films presented in this series is unknown.

did.unittitle: St. Mihiel Drive

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Produced by the Signal Corps of the U.S. Army taken under action and service conditions in France. Film depicts General Pershing in his office; trucks and troops move up a road; artillery is fired; patrols cut through barbered wire; infantry advance behind tranks; DH-4 airplanes lined up on an airfield; artillery is moved, loaded, and fired; the infantry crosses captured enemy trenches; refugees are fed; POWs are hered to the rear. The St. Mihiel Drive was a World War I battle fought between September 12-15, 1918.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: All inquires to view films require advanced notice of at least 24 hours, and may necessitate notice of up to one week. Individual items, including those not available in modern formats, may be restricted from scholarly access at the discretion of RAC.

did.unittitle: One Out of Nine

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Cancer awareness film focusing on the on-going work at New York City's Memorial Cancer Center. Actor Fredric March narrates and appears in the film to urge viewers to donate to the Memorial Cancer Center Fund.

did.unittitle: Victory Clothing Drive

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Short public service announcement featuring Spencer Tracy encouraging Americans to donate clothes for European war victims.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Access copy currently unavailable. Please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

did.unittitle: The Effects of Morphine on Learned Adaptive Behavior and Experimental Neurosis in Cats
did.physdesc: Silent, Black & white, 6 minutes. Only available on original 16mm film.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: All inquires to view films require advanced notice of at least 24 hours, and may necessitate notice of up to one week. Individual items, including those not available in modern formats, may be restricted from scholarly access at the discretion of RAC.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Film from the Neurophysiology Laboratories and the Division of Psychiatry at the Otho S.A. Sprague Memorial Institute and the University of Chicago. Summary of experimental work by Jules H. Masserman, M.D., University of Chicago, and Adam Wikler, M.D., U.S. Public Health Service. Contains some graphic footage of experiments on cats in a laboratory setting.
